title: Brandi Glanville Breaks Silence On Having Suicidal Thoughts
description: Brandi Glanville, who is now finally finding her way back to a normal life, got candid about feeling tempted to end it all.
content:
Brandi Glanville Credits Her Children For Being Alive

The Bravo alum suddenly found herself contemplating life sometimes this summer and may have taken up that offer to leave if not for her kids. Glanville is mom to her two sons, whom she shares with her former husband, Eddie Cibrian.

The former reality star's nightmare began when she put the controversial aftermath of her Morocco girls' trip behind her and suddenly woke up with a swollen face. She recalled that everything seemed like a blur at first, then her face started alternating between swelling and sinking in.

"I felt like something was just eating me from the inside. I'm like, 'It's eating my flesh,'" Glanville said. Since then, it has been from one symptom to another and incessant trips to the doctors, which have drained her insurance and wallet.

Inside The Mother-Of-Two's Hunt For The Perfect Medical Fix

The former reality star added that her symptoms have seemed to worsen as time ticks on her getting a solution. She explained that the lump in her face moves to either position at will and extends to the rest of her body, obstructing normal function.

The Former Bravo Star Reminisced On Her Life Before Her Medical Issues

Comparison is a thief of joy, but Glanville did it anyway as she reflected on what it truly felt like missing out on life and the fun times, as she grappled with the swelling and pain. According to her, things almost looked similar to life during COVID-19, with the crazy side effects as a cherry on top.

The TV star declared that she missed getting intimate with men and socializing with her friends, emphasizing that the former, which was almost regular, has now become a luxury. Glanville confessed that she has lost her sensual touch and may have to learn how to kiss again.

The media personality also has to deal with the insecurity of her new appearance, which comes with severe anxiety and pain. Glanville stated that she felt like she had lost her old self to the reality of her sickness.

The 'RHOBH' Star Found A Glimpse Of Hope With New Treatment

She praised Dr. Michael R. Scoma for wanting to help her get better and making her return to the old Glanville a possible feat. PEOPLE reported that she traced the genesis of her health problems to the food consumed during the trip to Morocco.

The star shared that the food, mostly meat, was left open for hours outside with flies crawling all over them. Now that Scoma is attending to her case, the former Bravo Star cannot wait to get out of the house and "live again."

The medical practitioner gave further insights into how they have gone in treating Glanville's condition via a response to her post on X. He explained that while care for infectious diseases is an intensive one behind the scenes, it is also a personal journey.

Scoma has been helping to treat her condition and expressed his belief in her ability to return to her former self.

Brandi Glanville Revisits Bravo Feud By Christening Her Facial Parasite
By Afouda Bamidele on August 5, 2025 at 1:30 PM EDT
Brandi Glanville just gave her face parasite a name and, in true "Real Housewives" fashion, it is petty!
The reality star revealed she dubbed the unwelcome intruder "Caroline," a not-so-subtle jab at her longtime rival Caroline Manzo.
Brandi Glanville's return to the spotlight follows a rough chapter in her career, one that began when rumors swirled that she crossed the line with Manzo during filming, leading to the early exit that sent her into a troubled spiral.
Brandi Glanville Burns Face With Nair Trying To Evict Her Facial Parasite
Glanville is taking beauty DIY to a whole new and dangerous level. She shocked fans after sharing a graphic TikTok update on her ongoing battle with a facial parasite, which she nicknamed "Caroline" after longtime enemy Caroline Manzo.
In the video, Glanville revealed she used Nair, a hair-removal cream, as a way to exfoliate her skin and annoy the parasite she claims is living in her face. With a deadpan expression, she noted, "When I have an exfoliated face, it pisses Caroline off, whoever's living in my face."
The unconventional method backfired, leaving her with visible burns and damaged skin. "She's moved from here to up there," Glanville explained, referencing "Caroline," while zooming in on her cheekbone and forehead.
In her caption, she shared a DIY treatment to ease the pain: "Mix up some aloe Vera, cucumber, and black tea. Put it in the freezer. Put it in the spray bottle and once it's cold enough, spray all day."
The TV Personality Says 'Housewives' Scandal Ruined Her Life
Based on her recent TikTok video, Glanville is not done unpacking the emotional fallout from her time on "The Real Housewives: Ultimate Girls Trip." It is worth noting that in April, she made it clear that the off-camera damage runs deeper than viewers might think.
In a revealing interview, Glanville opened up about hitting rock bottom after being sent home from Morocco while filming the now-shelved fourth season of the Bravo spinoff.
The Blast noted that Glanville said her world crumbled when reports surfaced claiming she behaved inappropriately toward fellow castmate Caroline Manzo, an accusation she flat-out denies.
"It's ruined my life. Those [first] six months, I was in a fetal position on my couch, like, contemplating suicide [and I was] being called horrible things," she said bluntly.
She also revealed that the backlash cost her more than just her Bravo gig. "All my jobs were canceled," Glanville said, adding that the narrative around her exit moved so fast she did not even get a chance to defend herself before doors started slamming shut.
The 'Real Housewives Of Beverly Hills' Alum Says Illness Has Drained Her Finances
View this post on Instagram
To make matters worse, as she lost her financial footing, she began to deal with a lingering illness that has not let up. Glanville revealed that she is still battling a mystery illness that has cost her more than just peace of mind.
The Blast highlighted Glanville's emotional confession that she is now financially wiped out, having spent more than $113,000 out-of-pocket on treatment after hitting a wall with her insurance plan.
"I'm out of funds. I'm out over six figures at this point. I don't have the means to go anywhere at this point. I'm online every day, going down a different rabbit hole. It's exhausting. It's all-consuming," she shared.
The Reality TV Star Says Parasite Has Robbed Her Of Sex, Confidence, And Herself
The mysterious parasite has not just drained her bank account; it has also stolen the parts of life she enjoys most. Mourning the version of herself she once knew, Glanville noted that her current life was as isolated as during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The 52-year-old admitted bluntly, "I miss socializing with my girlfriends and then having sex with men. I'm a Scorpio. I love sex. So, I was having a lot of it, and now I haven't had any of it, and I'm like, 'Have I forgotten how to kiss?'"
Known for her outspoken and unfiltered takes, she did not stop there. Glanville confessed that the ongoing health battle has chipped away at her once-solid sense of self.
"I've lost myself," she said. "I feel more insecure than I ever have in my life. I don't get anxiety about most things. Some things do give me anxiety, don't get me wrong, but I feel like I lost Brandi."
Brandi Glanville's Mysterious Parasite Gets Traced To Morocco Trip
After years of confusion and pain, Glanville may finally have some answers, and she is not alone in her misery. Last month, The Blast reported that fellow Bravo star Vicki Gunvalson believes she contracted the same parasite that has been wreaking havoc on Glanville's life.
The "Real Housewives of Orange County" alum said the symptoms began after the pair's 2023 trip to Morocco for "Real Housewives Ultimate Girls Trip."
Gunvalson did not mince words. She described the environment as less than sanitary and shared that Glanville's condition is severe, with the parasite moving to different parts of her body and causing intense discomfort. And it has not been easy for Gunvalson either.
Medical tests confirmed parasites had overrun her gut, and while both women are still not out of the woods, the likely source of their health nightmare has finally been pinpointed.
Clearly, the Housewives drama is not a thing of the past for Brandi Glanville.

Brandi Glanville hasn’t felt “normal” in two years.
“I’ve never felt suicidal before, [but earlier this summer], I didn’t want to be here,” Glanville, 52, tells Us Weekly in a new exclusive interview. “And if it wasn’t for my kids, I don’t know that I would be here.” (Glanville shares sons Mason and Jake with ex-husband Eddie Cibrian.)
Years after her initial departure from The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills, Glanville was back at the top of her reality TV game when she signed on for the planned fourth season of The Real Housewives Ultimate Girls Trip in Morocco in early 2023. She had just won over audiences again on The Real Housewives Ultimate Girls Trip: Ex-Wives Club and season 1 of The Traitors, but things took a turn when she was accused of sexual misconduct by RHUGT costar Caroline Manzo. (In court documents related to the incident, an executive producer stated that Manzo felt “disrespected” by Glanville but claimed Glanville did not “sexually violate” Manzo.)
When she returned home from Morocco, Glanville slipped into a depression about the controversy and subsequently discovered she had contracted a parasite while filming.
“Almost immediately upon landing, my phone started blowing up about these articles that were incorrect and not true about what happened in Morocco with Caroline, and I immediately took on a ton of anxiety,” she tells Us. “And I was just trying to get my head around what was happening and why it was happening. I was on the couch in a fetal position for four months.”
When Glanville attempted to socialize again, she started noticing “crazy lumps” in her face.
“My face started, like, moving around and doing things. I started to lose my eyesight in my left eye. It’s insane,” she says. “At first, my face was blowing up and getting really swollen. Then it started sinking in, and I felt like something was just eating me from the inside. I’m like, ‘It’s eating my flesh.’”
Glanville’s most extreme symptoms over the last two years also include gray spots on her “sunken-in” face, fluid that comes out of her left ear or drains into her mouth and extreme headaches.
Glanville has seen 21 doctors, paying for several out of pocket when she couldn’t get answers from providers within her insurance. “They didn’t believe me,” she says. “My insurance was like, ‘Nothing’s wrong with you. It’s just inflammation and old filler.’”
Glanville has spent at least $130,000 on medical bills and is struggling financially.
“I’m paying the minimum on my credit cards. I’ve exhausted my savings. At my age, I feel like such a loser in a way, because I was taking care of everything,” she says. “I was together. I had great credit. Now I’m scared about every little thing.”
Acknowledging that “medical bills are the No. 1 cause of bankruptcy,” Glanville has started working with Rachel Strauss, a healthcare strategist, known as the PBM Princess.
“Where it does fall on her responsibility is working with the hospitals she saw to review what was billed and making sure it was billed properly. There are certain things that were truly emergencies that doctors will validate, and [we can get] those reduced however we can,” Strauss tells Us. “Once we negotiate the service fees, we’ll work on a payment plan so that Brandi can live and have a roof over her head and be able to have food and everything that you need to sustain.”
Despite the financial strain caused by all the appointments, Strauss notes that it’s important Glanville advocated for herself when she believed the doctors within her insurance plan weren’t listening to her.
“Now that she has a definitive diagnosis, she’s able to go back, and that’s where she can start advocating financially,” she says. “There was something wrong, and that’s where we have to go back and make sure that insurance understands that, because that is why she went out of network.”
Glanville has also started new treatments with Dr. Michael R. Scoma, an infectious disease specialist who reached out to her via X. One day before her visit with Us, she began Dr. Scoma’s multiphase treatment plan, which kicks off with several weeks of intravenous antibiotics via a PICC line to treat her longstanding infection and its secondary effects.
“We can expect to see meaningful progress within the next few weeks,” Dr. Scoma tells Us. “And I do believe Brandi can make a full recovery.”
Calling herself a “hopeful wreck,” Glanville says she wants to get her life back.
“I was sleeping until 5 p.m. I couldn’t get out of bed. Everything ached — at one point, I couldn’t move my neck. I couldn’t get out of bed for four hours. And I’m just like, ‘This is not an existence,’” she tells Us. “I stay in this house every day. I’m paying crazy amounts of rent. I’m worrying about money all day long. I have brain fog. I get one thing done a day, and I’m just frazzled.”
Just last week, when she hit a low, she called her mom for support.
“I go, ‘Mom, I know you have Grandma. I know you have Dad. I know you have your plate full, but I need you to come,’” Glanville recalls. “And so she, like, dropped everything and came for a couple days. I colored her hair, and we had girl time.”
That pampering also included the now-viral clip of Glanville putting Nair on her face.
“I was just going down every rabbit hole, and my face loved exfoliation. It was like, ‘OK, I’m gonna get whatever this is out.’ So I would exfoliate, like, five times a day, and I wouldn’t even put moisturizer on and it was back to oily — and I never had oily skin,” she tells Us. “If Nair dissolves hair, maybe, it’ll dissolve whatever’s in my skin. And my mom’s like, ‘You do your Brandi.’ Like, when I was little, I used Comet on my teeth because I wanted white teeth. That’s just my idea. I’m a do-it-yourselfer. It doesn’t always work out. But honestly, she put tea bags on my skin after to make it, like, cool down, and they were brown, and so it looked like my face was scorched when really it was just a little bit pink.”
Following treatments from Dr. Scoma, however, Glanville hopes to be back to “dancing on tables and [drinking] sake.”
“No, I just want to leave my house,” she says again. “I’m in Groundhog Day.”
If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chat at 988lifeline.org.

Brandi Glanville Breaks Silence On Broke Status Amid Being 'Out Over Six Figures' In Medical Bills
By Afouda Bamidele on April 18, 2025 at 12:15 PM EDT
Brandi Glanville's persistent illness has done more than ruin her facial features, with her finances in the red.
The former "Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" star recently got vulnerable about her financial woes, noting her mystery illness was the root of all her problems. She went public with the health issue in 2023, revealing it had caused significant changes to her face.
Brandi Glanville previously blamed her face disfigurement on Bravo, claiming her issues with the network had taken a toll on her health. However, in the past year, she has visited several doctors for a cure, but no luck so far.
Brandi Glanville Claims She Is Flat Broke Thanks To Her Mystery Illness
During a recent interview, Glanville did not hold back while lamenting the state of her finances amid her mystery health problems. She confessed to having little to her name, claiming she had spent a significant sum on medical bills alone.
"I'm out of funds. I'm out over six figures at this point. I don't have the means to go anywhere at this point. I'm online every day, going down a different rabbit hole. It's exhausting. It's all-consuming," Glanville lamented.
She noted she had spent "over $113,000" in her efforts to find a treatment outside of her health insurance plan. Glanville was forced to take this more expensive route after exhausting all the options covered by Kaiser insurance, per US Magazine.
The Former Bravolebrity Wants A Committed Doctor
View this post on Instagram
Glanville expressed displeasure over her persistent health issues, revealing she wanted a medical professional who could commit to her case in the long run. "I just wanna find a doctor who makes it, like, his mission to help me. And not just me," she shared, adding:
"[But] these other poor women who have been going through this for so long, and men, too. I've had a couple men reach out. I feel for them, like, I know exactly what they're talking about."
"The pressure in their head, how they feel it's gonna explode. … I'm at my wits' end," Glanville confessed. She stressed that she had visited numerous doctors and tried different treatment plans. However, she has not found a concrete diagnosis or a substantive treatment plan.
Glanville Sheds More Light On Her Bizarre Symptoms
Glanville emphasized the importance of finding a cure to her mystery illness, noting the bizarre symptoms she experienced seemed to worsen with time.
"There's a lump in my neck and my throat under my cheekbone that goes to the other side of my face," she explained, claiming numerous tests could not pinpoint "whatever's living in [her] face."
"It's moving down my body, like, literally in my neck now moving on my left shoulder [and] down my arm. I have to get up, I have to stretch, I have to get in a hot tub. I have a routine and it sucks," Glanville lamented. Despite her pain, she enjoyed a little relief thanks to a new Cellsound treatment.
She described the treatment as "ultrasound therapy," noting it worked well in pissing off whatever was living in her body. "It gives me reprieve from the pressure, and it's been very helpful," Glanville raved about the procedure. She also got similar results from stem cell treatments with Dr. Joy Kong.
The 'RHOBH' Alum Misses Living Life To The Fullest
View this post on Instagram
The worst part of the mystery illness for Glanville wasn't losing her finances but "missing out on life." She compared her current isolation to the COVID-19 pandemic, noting it felt like she was on lockdown all over again but with "miserable side effects."
"I miss socializing with my girlfriends and then having sex with men. I'm a Scorpio. I love sex. So, I was having a lot of it, and now I haven't had any of it, and I'm like, 'Have I forgotten how to kiss?'" Glanville lamented, adding:
"But, like, I've lost myself. I feel more insecure than I ever have in my life. Normally, I feel fairly secure, and I don't get nervous. I don't get anxiety about most things. Some things do give me anxiety, don't get me wrong, but I feel like I lost Brandi."
Brandi Glanville Offloads Her Wardrobe To Ease Financial Constraints
Glanville's financial woes first made headlines in March, with The Blast covering her desperate attempt to earn more money. She revealed she had been surviving off her savings for about two years and moved to sell some of her famous outfits from her time on Bravo.
The former reality TV star assured fans the profits would go into her medical expenses, uploading various stunning designs from her collection on eBay. At the time of the report, Glanville's clothes had garnered bids between $500 and $1,000.
Glanville's efforts to gain money followed her frustrations with doctors for being unable to cure her mystery illness. She complained about severe symptoms, including painful lumps in her jaw and neck, persistent chills, and a foul-tasting drainage from her face that damaged her teeth.
Will Brandi Glanville find a cure for her mystery illness before her finances run out?

argos_summary: Brandi Glanville, a former Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star, has been battling a mysterious illness—believed to be a parasite contracted during a 2023 trip to Morocco—that has caused severe facial swelling, pain, and other debilitating symptoms. She has seen 21 doctors, spent over $130,000 out‑of‑pocket, and struggled with insurance denial, leading to significant financial strain and the sale of her wardrobe. Glanville credits her children for keeping her alive and has recently found hope with infectious disease specialist Dr. Michael Scoma, who is treating her with a multi‑phase antibiotic regimen. The ordeal has also taken a toll on her mental health, social life, and sense of self, but she remains optimistic about recovery and returning to normal life.
